skill.name: gitlab-ci-patterns
skill.description: Build GitLab CI/CD pipelines with multi-stage workflows, caching, and distributed runners for scalable automation. Use when implementing GitLab CI/CD, optimizing pipeline performance, or setting up automated testing and deployment.
skill.summary: Build GitLab CI/CD pipelines with multi-stage workflows, caching, and distributed runners for scalab...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only static GitLab CI YAML examples and DevOps guidance. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file access behavior is present. The content is informational only.

content.value_statement: Teams often struggle to design reliable GitLab CI workflows at scale. This skill provides proven pipeline patterns for builds, tests, deployments, caching, and scanning.
actual_capabilities: Provide a basic multi-stage pipeline with build, test, and deploy jobs
Show Docker build and push jobs with registry login steps
Provide multi-environment Kubernetes deployment templates using kubectl
Outline Terraform validate, plan, and apply pipeline stages
Include security scanning patterns with GitLab templates and Trivy
Show caching patterns and child pipeline generation examples
limitations: Does not execute or validate pipelines in a live GitLab project
Examples require project-specific variables and files to be configured
Does not provide secrets management beyond CI variable mentions
Runner setup and configuration details are not included

use_cases.title: Standardize CI templates
use_cases.description: Create consistent GitLab CI patterns for multiple repositories and teams.

use_cases.title: Add deployment stages
use_cases.description: Extend an existing pipeline with Kubernetes deployment jobs.

use_cases.title: Speed up pipelines
use_cases.description: Apply caching and artifact patterns to reduce build times.

prompt_templates.title: Starter pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a simple GitLab CI pipeline with build, test, and deploy stages for a Node.js service.

prompt_templates.title: Docker build push
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a GitLab CI job to build and push Docker images on main and tags.

prompt_templates.title: Terraform workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate validate, plan, and apply stages for Terraform with manual apply.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-env deploy
prompt_templates.prompt: Design staging and production deploy jobs using kubectl with a shared template.

output_examples.input: Show a GitLab CI pipeline for build, test, and deploy with caching
output: Stages are build, test, and deploy in order
Build job uses node:20 and caches node_modules
Test job runs lint and tests with coverage reporting
Deploy job applies Kubernetes manifests and waits for rollout

best_practices: Use specific image tags for reproducible builds
Cache dependencies with stable keys to speed up jobs
Use manual approval gates for production deployments
anti_patterns: Using latest image tags in production pipelines
Skipping artifacts for build outputs needed downstream
Deploying to production without an approval gate

faq.question: Which GitLab versions are supported?
faq.answer: Patterns target standard GitLab CI features and work on recent GitLab versions.

faq.question: Are there limits on pipeline size?
faq.answer: Limits depend on your GitLab plan and runner capacity, not on this skill.

faq.question: Can this integrate with existing runners?
faq.answer: Yes, examples assume standard GitLab runners and can be adapted to your setup.

faq.question: Is any sensitive data collected?
faq.answer: No, content is static documentation without file, environment, or network access.

faq.question: What if a job fails after using this?
faq.answer: Check runner logs, image availability, and variable configuration, then adjust.

faq.question: How does this compare to GitHub Actions?
faq.answer: Focuses on GitLab CI syntax and features instead of GitHub Actions workflows.
